website_summaries.verdict: The best option if you need to be completely sure that you can jump a dead car battery or recharge your devices whenever you need to.
pros: Jump starts up to 80 times between charges
Charge devices via USB or 12-volt connections
cons: This durable jump starter is a pricy model

customer_reviews.title: Internal battery voltage is low but works.
customer_reviews.text: Update: It’s18 months old and worked on a battery that was completely dead. I had to use the override button but it worked great. Original review: Amazon is selling old stock or their improper storage has damaged the battery upon arrival. These are suppose to charge to 12.8 volts per the label on the back. First one charges to 12.5 volts. Second one to 12.3 volts. This equals about a year of use in my mind. Since I'm paying full price I want a fully charged jumper and not something that is the equivalent of a used 1 year old device.

customer_reviews.title: Does not charge
customer_reviews.text: We own a fleet of trucks that carry vehicles across the country, we often have vehicles do not start after being on the trailer for 1 week. Open up the box, so excited to take it out on a long trip. Charge it up the night before, next morning still not charging. Brought to my friends who has the same jumper, his charger does not charge it either. So disappointed! Now we have to wait another week to see if we can do an exchange. We were hoping to buy 7 of these, one for each truck. We will give you guys one more chance.
customer_reviews.author: Sana Daniels

customer_reviews.title: Loved it, now HATE it
customer_reviews.text: Loved it, now HATE it. Worked great till it stopped boosting anything, I returned it and got another. Now the second one just stopped jumping anything and I am outside my return window. Are you kidding me! Several hundred dollars out the window. My $69.00 booster is still working after a year. I've had this thing since September 2017, and it is now January 2018. Less than 4 months for hundreds of dollars!!! Unbelievable.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product but no luck with my last 2 purchase
customer_reviews.text: Bought a few of these but my first GB150 never worked. It is not holding the charge at all.
customer_reviews.author: Mark brutus

customer_reviews.title: Did not work on my sprinter van
customer_reviews.text: My sprinter's battery dropped to 4.v volts after 2 weeks of sitting idle. After connecting up the cable and turning the booster on, the battery voltage read 11.5, however there was not enough juice to turn the starter. I needed to use my car to jump start the van. I am guessing the van's battery was just too low. Very disappointed. Any yes, the booster was fully charged and was at room temperature.
customer_reviews.author: Woodchuck

customer_reviews.title: It worked a few times..
customer_reviews.text: Was good for a few months and then it just died. Only used it a couple of times. Holding the power on but nothing turns on..lights comes on when its on the charger (fully charged as well)
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Grimsley

customer_reviews.title: BURNT CLAMPS
customer_reviews.text: Upon first use, I was charging up a 2002 Camry, in line four Cylinder engine, both of the terminal clamps heated up and almost burned the terminals. This product was faulty and very dangerous to use. I do not recommend this product. Look at the pictures.
customer_reviews.author: BV

customer_reviews.title: Not rugged at all. Tiny screws holding the covers together
customer_reviews.text: Dropped it less than a foot from the ground cover/housing broke open. Contacted noco I was told I need to send it back and have it repaired for roughly about 200 bucks I was also suggest better off buying another one. So now I got a few extra long zip tie to keep it together. If it would not withstand less than a foot drop then they shouldn't claim how tough this thing is. As far as jumping power I was pretty satisfied. Only wish this thing is a little more rugged as it looks. Also it would be great if the clamps are replaceable
customer_reviews.author: Wayne

customer_reviews.title: This will make you a hero
customer_reviews.text: This is a great tool to have in your vehicle for emergency situations. Charging is easy and lasts a long time. It feels great to know that I have a backup plan in case I have a battery issue or someone I come across needs help. Gone are the chances jumper cables potentially fry your ECM. I could see the phone charger port coming in handy as well. I used this for the first time in my daughters car when she left her headlights on all night and not only did it start right up, it measured the battery output to let me know if the battery was bad. Who doesn’t want to be Johnny on the Spot?
customer_reviews.author: Kemosabe

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: Amazing - jumped a dual battery Humvee H1 with completely dead batteries that has been sitting for 2 months. I connected it and by the time I walked around to get in and start - it was turning over fully. It took 20 turns (fuel related) then fired up. When I brought this genius boost it home to charge it - it was still at 75%.
customer_reviews.author: Perioman

customer_reviews.title: GB 150 is junk. Avoid the 2-$300 Boost pro model.
customer_reviews.text: Lasted for one use in a 1 year time span. Now the unit won’t turn on regardless of charge status or environmental temperature. Green light says “100%” but unit won’t stay on...not even the auxiliary white light will stay on. Junk product. Would not recommend wasting 2-$300 on the GB150
customer_reviews.author: Sybil Grrenberg Cummin

customer_reviews.title: Received USED Item
customer_reviews.text: Opened the packaging yesterday, and noticed that the package looked a little weathered... I figured it was just from being in a warehouse. Opened its up, and the unit was obviously used. There were scratches all over it, as well as grease, and a few spots of who knows what. I was going to just request a replacement, but after also leaving it to charge all night, and as of this morning it's still dead.. I'm going to say the heck with this thing.
customer_reviews.author: mjudkins

customer_reviews.title: PROBLEMS
customer_reviews.text: We are a small tow company in the OKC area. We purchased several of these units. We have sent several back to the comany to get fixed under warranty. The GB 150 is the second one that has gone bad just outside of the 1 year warranty. The products that I have bought from Noco have been very poor. Very disappointed the the Noco Genius products. We have had problems with several GB 70's and a few of the GB 150's. The latest one to go bad after the warranty is the GB 150. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Partyof9

customer_reviews.title: No way to charge from the wall socket.
customer_reviews.text: The unit has a lot of potential ... certainly has the power to start even the most beefy of trucks and vans, but the only way to charge it up is either by USB (which is VERY slow), or to plug it into a 12V source. Sadly the only 12V charge cable it comes with is for a car outlet. There is no wall brick or equivalent option to charge the unit from a more powerful source of power. Charging from 1 to a full battery will likely take the better part of 24 hours using a 10W USB charger.
customer_reviews.author: Rodney A.

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny and your wife won't be mad after you need it that ONE time!
customer_reviews.text: Already used this about 8 times and still don't need to charge it. I have a 6.0 liter diesel. Not an easy Jumpstart. Jumped it 3 times before getting my issue corrected and my Toyota 4 or 5 times. Still holding its initial charge from 4 months ago after all of that! Wife was upset at first since it's spendy... until I just walked out and got her Denali fired up without running a cord and grabbing stuff and she didn't have to wait for anything other than my TOLD YOU THIS WAS COOL look! Unfortunately we got our battery and alternator issues worked out ... so I keep it for emergencies in the truck for other people now.
customer_reviews.author: driegle

customer_reviews.title: I hope this works when needed
customer_reviews.text: Had purchased several Weego jumpers in this category as gifts a few years back. Advertised to jump a diesel. Being a Captain I thought these were great insurance for fellow captains offshore. Well three times my Chevy (3500) pedestrian van had a dead battery. It was cold out but thats why you buy these right? Could not start on three occasions. Weego claims it was too cold and the van has "a lot of electronics". Wont be purchasing another Weego nowhere product! The GB150 is rather large, just wish for the money they included the case.
customer_reviews.author: Sgt #23

customer_reviews.title: Bought as a "Deal of the Day" - what a joke saved 10% only
customer_reviews.text: First time I used the unit...so far it seems to be working but afraid to leave it unattended as others have reported fires!! The most recent reviews, mostly negative, have me worried and with only a 30-day return window that has already come and gone gives me the impression this is not a quality product and they want no part in dealing with unhappy customers. I am praying it works for a reasonable lenght of time...fingers are crossed. Never buy this unit on sale, it is so expensive to begin with and the 10% savings is not worth it unless you really need something, then shop around.
customer_reviews.author: M. Lee

customer_reviews.title: Powerful jumper
customer_reviews.text: Powerful jumper. Very happy. Tried to jumper my semi. But couldn’t cause I found out I had a bad battery. But my APU on my semi cranked with it with no problem. And I take it everywhere I go (in my semi truck and in my pickup truck). Update: Saw someone that needed a jump and was able to jump their car on a dead battery with ease.
customer_reviews.author: Dinh

customer_reviews.title: Will not charge and will not hold a charge
customer_reviews.text: My $60 lead acid jump starter is far superior to this overpriced lithium ion jump starter. NOCO customer support is no help as the jumper is out of warranty. Who ever heard of a lithium ion battery not lasting 2 and 1/2 years. Actually it went defective sooner but I can't prove it and as customer support says "the warranty is for 1 year". Would give it "0" stars but Amazon only allowed me to choose one star as the lowest rating........NOCO is junk
customer_reviews.author: A Mom

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: Got this to support my diesel pickup with Cummins. Not that I need it but you never know. So this weekend I went to start my aunt’s car and it was totally dead. The GB150 started it easily and I didn’t even need to read the instructions. Very easy to use. It is huge compared to the other starter packs I got for my cars. Hope to not need it but good to know it works.
customer_reviews.author: steveb

customer_reviews.title: Beast mode!
customer_reviews.text: Seriously impressive portable power unit by the specs and other reviews. Hard to believe the output potential of this thing when activating the override feature. Only thing I think they missed on was not putting some sort of a handle on it. Kind of unwieldy to hang onto with one hand. Large Velcro strap solved that issue. I own several other NOCO AC chargers 6 & 12 V and have been impressed. Tucked this one securely under the driver seat of the truck so it can be kept connected to 12 V outlet during the winter months. Much easier than luggin around my HD jump pack. Looking forward to checking real world performance.
customer_reviews.author: Doctorzero

customer_reviews.title: No 110V Charger
customer_reviews.text: IF you need to charge this quick, this is NOT for you. By quick I mean 24 hours. It DOES NOT come with a 110v wall charger. You gotta use the Micro USB cord that is about as fast as a phone charger. A phone charger takes FOREVER to charge this big thing. Next best option is a cigarette lighter. But if you are having charging issues in your vehicle (dead alternator or whatever) then it won't charge in there, since it's probably why you have to use it to begin with. Needs a wall charger. Included. Period.
customer_reviews.author: H.W.N.

customer_reviews.title: Better than I ever expected (Don't Hesitate Buy)
customer_reviews.text: An amazing product. I have a Toyota tundra eight cylinder. I disconnected the battery and just hooked the GB150 up to the terminals, turned the headlights on, and the air conditioner blower motor on high,,, the truck started up as if it had a brand-new battery in it the whole time. No hesitation! No lag time! Product is better than advertised. Everyone that can afford one should have one,,,,,,IMHHO
customer_reviews.author: Bobby

customer_reviews.title: Impressive for its size
customer_reviews.text: I've had the gb150 for almost a year now and haven't found anything yet it wouldn't start. I've used it on everything from atvs to large diesel tractors with weak batteries even no batteries and it's worked every time. Now it dosent have the reserve capacity of a lead acid based jump starter like thewhich I also have but it does provide as much if not more cranking power in a package 1/3 the size and less than 1/2 the weight. Really the only cons I've found are the short cables and the price. Pros: * Big cranking power * Compact size * Lightweight * Seems to be well built Cons: * Expensive * Short Cables * Low reserve capacity
customer_reviews.author: Dm93

customer_reviews.title: different then my other noco gb150
customer_reviews.text: i already have a noco GB150 that i use all the time and works just fine i seen a sale on these for cyber monday and bought a second just because! well when i received it... it looks different then the original one i had.. cheaper made.. not sure if thats how they got them on a deal or what but beware this is different then what you might buy on the actual noco site
customer_reviews.author: Squirrelly

customer_reviews.title: Trash!
customer_reviews.text: Had this GB150 for around 10 months now. Tried to use it on 2 occasions and it did absolutely nothing. Both times regular jumper cables worked just fine. 70 degree weather, fully charged and doesn't work at all. Not only that but the charging port seems to have been dislodged inside. I have only pulled this out of the hard case I purchased for it Teo Times! Very disappointed. Don't waste your money on this product!
customer_reviews.author: K. C.

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't preform as described
customer_reviews.text: Try to jump off a 26' straight internatonal V8 Diesel with less than 10 liter. I think its a 6.7l to be exact. Didnt have enought power with it fully charged. In Florida climate between 60- 70 degrees in November. This was the first opportunity I had to test the product and of course its after the return period once I found out it does not perform as described.
customer_reviews.author: Jereme

customer_reviews.title: Powerful, Convenient, and Full-Featured
customer_reviews.text: I've used this product several times to jump-start engines from a 1.8L 4-cyl to a 14L natural gas generator with great results! Smaller engines crank right up and even the larger ones start with relative ease. The built-in voltmeter is awesome for determining charge state of dead batteries and also easily checking alternator function after the engine cranks over. The longer leads compared to the smaller models are a huge plus as well. Overall, great product and well-worth the investment! Not needing a second vehicle or jumper cables to start an engine with a dead battery comes in very handy.
customer_reviews.author: Alec Prestifilippo

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work on dead batteries, only weak ones.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is crazy strong. But if the battery is completely dead then it won't work. I've thought it was broken multiple times because it wouldn't work. But no, I guess some genius decided to make them not work when jumping a battery that's really dead. Why would you make a jumper pack that only works on weak batteries and not on dead ones too. I definitely feel robbed for the price on this thing. It has plenty of power when it works. Turns over my 7.3 powers troke with ease. But if someone's got an old car where leaving the lights on can drain the battery all the way, this product it absolutely worthless.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Enough power to start about anything
customer_reviews.text: The jumper is no small jumper that you will have to charge after a few starts. It does come with a pouch to cover the jumper that I didn’t want to use because I wanted to store it in a sling bag to make it easier to carry around. The unit was packed very well to protect it, also It comes with cords to plug into the cigarette lighter port. This one of the best on the market with a battery voltage reader, heavy duty cables and clamps for a sure connecting jump.
customer_reviews.author: Troy G.

customer_reviews.title: Stopped functioning after 1 year, used maybe 3 times
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased multiple Noco products for both personal use and for my company, and up until recently I have been very impressed with them. I bought a GB150 for personal use for my shop at home. It did not get used very much at all. But at the moment I needed it most, it failed. After 14 months it would no longer recognize a battery. Noco has a 1 yr warranty, and they don't stand behind that product beyond the warranty period. No way to repair or service one. I basically purchased a $300 flashlight, because the charge function does not work. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Oechsner

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: Bought the GB150 as an emergency back up to jump start my motorhome. I have never used it because it will not charge over 25%. It was defective right out of the box. I have charged it for hours using USB and also the 12v system. Will be returning it for repair and will have to pay NOCO to fix it.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne Girard

customer_reviews.title: a must have for used vehicles
customer_reviews.text: awsome product. jumps my 2001 f250 7.3 no problem. never had something so powerful so small. recomended for anyone that has an older vehicle. keeps charge for months.Update: jump bought my second one for my father, continues to jump anything I throw at it. I've read a lot of reviews and notice most people buy the jump pack just enough to jump your vehicle,do yourself a favor and always get one or two sizes bigger than what u need just to be on the safe side. Just jumped a completely dead 2015 ram 3500 Cummins diesel first try!
customer_reviews.author: eslonger

customer_reviews.title: Noco has great customer sevice.
customer_reviews.text: I had to have this replaced twice. First time I had to charge this it didn't charge. So I sent it back and got a replacement. We ended up buying 2 more. (we have a farm and always need it) It worked well for a few months but then wouldn't charge again. I called Noco and they were great! They sent me a new replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This unit works very well !!
customer_reviews.text: This is an absolutely fantastic product!! Fortunately, I bought this in October before a strong cold snap out of Canada. My diesel Jeep Liberty would barely even crank-over. Used the GB150, and in just a few cranks, the diesel came to life !! Also needed it again today for a diesel VW and a lawn tractor. Instant start for both. Charge drop on the GB150 after these 'starts' was minimal, as only the 100% green light was blinking. USB charger on 5 volts brought the charge back to 100% in less than an hour. I love this thing !! Good job NOCO
customer_reviews.author: JM

customer_reviews.title: Worked great until it stopped charging!!
customer_reviews.text: This product worked great for the first 5 months of everyday use. Didn't use it for a month, and then went to charge it and it would no longer take a charge. Have been slow in sending it in for warranty repair or replacement, will update once this is done. Right now I can't recommend paying $300 for something that isn't even going to last half a year.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I've never owned a better jumper pack! GB150 4000AMP
customer_reviews.text: So far I've jumped my 2016 2500 Dodge 6.7 Cummings Diesel 3-4 times when 1 of the 2 batteries died. It cranked instantly. A guy in the Walmart parking lot, started right up. My Nissan NV work van, started right up. This thing is a beast. I did go ahead and charge it after about 4 jumps, because the battery guage was on mid to low but well worth the money! Buy the case for it as well, it really should come with it.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: First item I received was defective
customer_reviews.text: I am only giving three stars because the first item I received was defective and would not hold a charge. I left it on a charger for over 24 hours. This particular item is the replacement item and it is working perfectly. It took a recharge like it was supposed to. Amazon Customer Service was great (as usual) in handling this situation. I got the replacement item within 2 days.
customer_reviews.author: C. M. Franz

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t work out of the box
customer_reviews.text: I purchased three of these GB40, GB50, and GB150. The GB150 will not hold a charge. Contacted support and I have to pay to ship it and have it looked at??? Not impressed! Pay $300 for a “quality” product and now pay again to make it work? Buy at your risk!
customer_reviews.author: K

customer_reviews.title: Waste
customer_reviews.text: I rarely write reviews but this rip off really needs one. Absolute waste of money. Barely started a car with a dead battery. Forget about starting a semi truck. We had a semi with 4 batteries that were dead. It had enough power to turn the lights on, that's about it. Don't buy it. Oh and they don't include an actual charger you would expect with a device like this. You'll get a charger you'd expect to charge a cellphone or e-cig.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: dependable product
customer_reviews.text: love this product. always dependable when the batteries of my SUV go dead. and it can power the tire inflator when the car tires accidentally get flat. only charged it twice since i purchased it last January 2019. highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: ted k

customer_reviews.title: NOCO GB150 - Works as stated
customer_reviews.text: Been researching this type of booster pack for about 10 months - made my decision and bought the NOCO GB150 ... It arrived 10/16/2020 - charged it up using the 12 volt 5 amp charger input - from dead to full charge is took 5 hours.. On 10/17/2020 - disconnected car batteries in three of my vehicles- Toyota Camry, Lexus RX380, Ford F-350 6.7L turbo diesel - used three sets of jumper cables connected to NOCO GB150 - turned on the NOCO GB150 pressed the power over ride button - with three of my friends in the driver seat - started all three vehicles at the same time with no issues ...
customer_reviews.author: Williebl8

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn’t purchase again.
customer_reviews.text: I received this about two days ago and immediately put it on the charger. It took about 40 hours to charge via the USB port. Once charged, it started up my V8 1977 Mercedes, without hesitation. Twice! The battery pack was then at around 50% (or at least the two of four lights were glowing), after only two starts. After that, I tried putting back on the USB charger and it will no longer take a charge. Maybe I got a lemon, but very unsatisfied with how it holds a charge and now that it won’t charge via the USB. For the cost of the unit, I’m very unsatisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Hansen

customer_reviews.title: Don't leave home without it!
customer_reviews.text: Just purchased about a week ago, WON'T be leaving home without it EVER. UNBELIEVABLE! Using my remote this morning I noticed that I couldn't unlock the door so had to unlock the car with the key. In less than 2 minutes from unlocking the door, popping the hood connecting the Genius GB150 and pushing the on button my car started without hesitation. Don't settle for a cheaper unit.
customer_reviews.author: C W Dycus

customer_reviews.title: Works great; nice product; cannot jump from cigarette lighter
customer_reviews.text: This product turned over my *really* hard-to-turn-over high-performance sports car engine that basically has a semi's battery because of the high-compression engine. It's easy to use and handle and it's exactly what I hoped for. One thing to note that might be confusing based on the description: you cannot use the cigarette lighter attachment to jump start the car (you need to connect it to the battery terminals like a normal jump). You can only to charge the unit itself from there.
customer_reviews.author: S. Thomas

customer_reviews.title: you can not rely on it to work
customer_reviews.text: 80% of the time I have tried to use this it just sits there clicking and not actually working. if you hook up jumper cables from a good vehicle it then does something. the only time it does something on its own is if the engine being jumped has a good battery that is slightly low and probably start fine already. extremely disappointed cheep no name Chinese lithium jumper works far better.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Will not hold a good charge over time.
customer_reviews.text: When is New is great,the bad thing about it over time is not that great I have had this about 1.5 years and it doesn't hold a charge any more it only charges up to 75% I can leave it charging all day but it will no longer go to 100% and when I used it, it drops to 25%. 75% sounds great but the charge is very weak I can only jump one car I work for AAA automotive I got this so i would not be carrying the big blue jump start box most of us used.Its great again when is new but overtime for the price i most say its not worth it. It should last longer
customer_reviews.author: Giovani henriquez

customer_reviews.title: Keeps going and going and going!!!
customer_reviews.text: It ia such a blessing to own this Jump Box because I travel all over the US. Amazingly, I have helped over 850 plus people since December 2019 restart their vehicles without any problems. I once jumped 70 cars in one day on a single charge. This has been by far one of my best investments. NOCO stands behind their products. You can't go wrong! I purchased the 4000 amp version.
customer_reviews.author: Dameian Battle, MBA

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: So just after the return period for amazon I get to use the jump pack for the first time when my car doesn’t start(1.9 Jetta tdi). Connect and nothing, the thing didn’t even give my phone a charge! And it had 100%! Figured it was too cold for it. So I got a ride home and brought it back the next day, 2nd time it gave enough power to turn the starter, but very slow. Went from 100% to dead within 15 min. 2 times/2 fails.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Soso
customer_reviews.text: I will update this as time goes by, so far I'm a little disappointed in how huge this 150gb is.. it's x10 my mini max, let's hope that's for a reason... Next it cost $300 but dose not come with a standard 120v socket charging plug... So I had to spend another $50 for charging cable ie 120v plug in. Next u also need to buy a case for the gb150 and then an case for the charging plug.. in total plan on spending around $450-$500
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: It works, as advertised
customer_reviews.text: When I purchased this unit, I wasn't convinced it would do what was advertised, the idea that a battery unit would start a 10 liter, dual battery diesel engine seemed like over-selling. However, recently I was able to put it to the test by starting an 8.6 liter, six-cylinder diesel on a field tractor with dead batteries. The GB150 spun the engine without strain or hesitation, starting it in a very few moments. That experience has raised my confidence that the GB150 will do the job when needed.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse T

customer_reviews.title: pretty powerful and compact
customer_reviews.text: I do roadside assistance, and for normal cars our standard booster pac 5000 works fine. But for diesels its not enough. This booster is plenty strong enough to start totally dead super dutys with no problem. People get confused when I pull this out of my work truck ('that aint gonna work') and then get shocked when it starts up easily. I love it. The volt meter is very useful to check alternator output. Well see how long it holds up.
customer_reviews.author: alphalanos

customer_reviews.title: It works!! Buy this thing
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 of these one in shop truck and one in carry with me I have started multiple vehicles stone dead on a single charge , never hesitates and starts them right up , jump started a weak semi with it as well , it has saved me I had the gb70 as well but this thing is awesome , going out to used cars just carry it with me its light its portable , built in cables are a decent length , love this thing cant go wrong
customer_reviews.author: JoeTheAutoGuy

customer_reviews.title: Hesitant buyer, finally got "the one" and it works great
customer_reviews.text: I was very leery about getting this unit after trying others and being let down. I fully charged this unit, made sure everything was set and ready, put the unit in override and I'll be a monkeys uncle, it worked; , it turned the engine over as if my completely dead batteries were new. I am truly impressed and believe this was an excellent purchase. 2006 F250 6.0.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Right off the bat, a problem...
customer_reviews.text: I just opened up my new Noco GB unit after having received it today, and was excited to charge it up to see how it would work. However, upon testing out the built-in light function, my excitement quickly turned to disappointment as I was not able to toggle the light modes at all (even to turn off the light), so it stays stuck on at 100% intensity indefinitely. I'll have to return it to Amazon like this to get a new unit right away.
customer_reviews.author: C. Wright

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product.  Easy to use, and operates as intended...
customer_reviews.text: I've already used this 3 times. It's a time saver since you have everything you need to jump a vehicle right there. It's safety features are really nice too. Will save you from arcing, or in the event you connect to the wrong posts. It's VERY important to read the instructions and understand the safety features, and how and why you must override them if the battery you are trying to jump is completely dead. I'm VERY impressed with this product so far...
customer_reviews.author: roger wtaylor

customer_reviews.title: awesome starter
customer_reviews.text: if you want something heavy duty that will definitely start your car, then get this. forget the cheaper ones, this one works like a charm and is basically industrial strength. i spent the extra money as this thing holds a charge and you can chuck it in the trunk just in case. i got one for my daughter's prius and it's in the trunk in case she needs it.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck T

customer_reviews.title: Several units and they all work great.
customer_reviews.text: We have several of these units between our service trucks and the shop. Never had any issue with these jump packs and we use these to boost heavy equipment such as dozers and excavators as well as smaller equipment. Also used on a handful of trucks up to a F-750 equivalent sized truck. Would buy again for the shop or service trucks. Even considered getting the next size down to keep in my personal truck.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony C.

customer_reviews.title: Monster equipment
customer_reviews.text: Its big...I just happened to have the Beatit BT-D11 jumper on hand when the postman needed a jump...it's ok but side by side, the NOCO GB150 is a heavy duty piece of equipment. With the cold winters, I'd rather have more than I need and this fits the bill...
customer_reviews.author: Richard Steiner

customer_reviews.title: This would not start my truck
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately when I really needed this device to work it didn’t. It had a full charge and was brand new. Never used once. Apparently it doesn’t start deisel trucks. I have a 2007 Duramax and it did not work. Returning it. Thanks to amazon for being so good about taking products back that would do not perform.
customer_reviews.author: DT

customer_reviews.title: Find something better!! HORRIBLE!!
customer_reviews.text: Horrible product!! I always heard you get what you pay for. This was one of the most expensive ones and it was a complete failure. Sent the first one back, they sent me another one. 2nd one was a a dud too. Don't waste your money. And then if that wasn't bad enough, I was stupid enough and bought ANOTHER one from a different place and it was crap too. Don't waste your time or money on this product. We had high hopes but were disappointed every time. It's very confusing to have to send back for repairs too so I have spent over $600 for NOTHING. UGH!!
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Great for Big Trucks
customer_reviews.text: This thing is powerhouse. I had a faulty battery on my 2017 Toyota Tundra 5.7 L V8 truck. I jump started my truck using my girlfriend's vehicle and it did not start very easy. The next day I used the NOCO boost and it started much easier. All the safety features and other benefits make this a great purchase. I am very happy and knowing I have this in my truck provides an extra layer of comfort while traveling.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Neely

customer_reviews.title: Thing works great for v8 turbo diesels
customer_reviews.text: Had it for a few months in my '15 Duramax. I charged it once, and have been using it ever since without refreshing the charge. One of the two batteries was dead over winter, so I would have to jump my 6.6 liter turbo diesel every 2 or 3 days. This thing works every time, and still hasn't been recharged. I was on the fence because it's so d!*n expensive, but it's worth it 100%.
customer_reviews.author: Online Customer

customer_reviews.title: NOCO is a no go for a 7 liter diesel
customer_reviews.text: The NOCO GB150 looks to be well made but it doesn't have the amperage needed to start a 7 liter diesel. The batteries on the diesel weren't even dead, just didn't have the reserve capacity to start the motor on their own. Granted it was a 7 liter cat diesel so it is not some whimpy motor you find in a pickup. But the claim of being able to start a 10 liter diesel may be a bit of a stretch.
customer_reviews.author: julie cattaneo

customer_reviews.title: Worked one time
customer_reviews.text: It work first time. Then I put it in it's bag with 75% battery life I tried to use it 2 weeks later battery is dead. I charged it %100 then I tried to use it to jump a car at the port did not work. I am a car hualer and that could cost me the whole week because I have to keep the cars 3 days until the port opens again but they had the blue jump and carry starter so I used it. I love the design of this product but I can't affort for this start to stop working when I really need it. I returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Ibrahim Assaf

customer_reviews.title: The little charger that could
customer_reviews.text: Seeing that all the reviews for the GB line are lumped together, this review is for the GB150. I can't believe something this small could fire up my diesel pusher motor home in the dead of winter within the first 30 seconds. I also thought it was crazy that this thing charges through USB but on a 2 amp charger i saw it fully charged from 25% the next day. I was initially thinking of getting a HD jump starter that is usually on a dolly but this is just as powerful. It's a nice touch that this comes with carry pouch. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Cab00b

customer_reviews.title: new news 2 years later  death and no more warranties !!
customer_reviews.text: the best buster pack i ever have it will starts truck or a car it’s doesn’t matter! not : gb150 will not charge Electric cars ! And will not work when is overheated ! You can use it for electric car secondary buster pack over the other regular one ! i know because i’m roadside service!! !!! only works for 2 years now 2 we have not working 325$ for 2 years only and of course no more warranties!! 🤨
customer_reviews.author: dalyan

customer_reviews.title: Best Battery Jumper on the market.
customer_reviews.text: This is my second purchase of this item. I have two 6 year old batteries in my diesel truck. If I haven't started the truck for two weeks in nice weather I only need to use one of them. If it is cold (20 degrees F or colder) I have to use both the jumpers. I really enjoy using them. I would recommend this jumper to everyone who has a vehicle.
customer_reviews.author: Paula

customer_reviews.title: This thing never worked, hopefully they do the right thing
customer_reviews.text: I charged it up according to the directions. I tried jumping a dead battery. It did not work maybe because the batteryvoltage was too low, Im not sure. I tried using the light, it did not work. I put it away for 8 months and tried charging it again. It will not charge. Is this junk or am i that unlucky? Let's see what they do with a warranty claim. I will update
customer_reviews.author: fivetenfifteentwenty

customer_reviews.title: and I am not disappointed. I prefer a portable jump starter to jumper ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this on recommendation from a friend, and I am not disappointed. I prefer a portable jump starter to jumper cables for safety purposes. The larger jump boxes are big, heavy and bulky, and take up a lot of space. This device fits easily in the rear floorboard of my truck. It is super easy to use. Connect to the battery and turn it on, then start the vehicle. It has the power to start larger vehicles, and can make a large number of starts on a single charge.
customer_reviews.author: Steve D.

customer_reviews.title: very reliable , not too heavy , easy yo use .
customer_reviews.text: I honestly can say I like everything about this great tool . I use it to start my Harley , I don't get around to riding it like I used to and the trickle charger doesn't do the job like it used to either , so this jumper is a great addition to my tools . Worth the money !
customer_reviews.author: chaye

customer_reviews.title: Shipment Short
customer_reviews.text: Unit arrived intact but SHORT one (1) NOCO Boost GB 150 (IN) Male Plug srl# NG15006x6x03201603046..if no response from customer service we will send back asap. We live off the grid and all equipment is required to be complete for immediate application. Will update review pending on response.
customer_reviews.author: robert l. nessier jr.

customer_reviews.title: Starts a 7.3L Diesel just fine.
customer_reviews.text: I've used this jumper box to start my Ford 7.3L IDI Diesel with dead batteries (the truck has 2 big batteries) 3 times now on a single charge, and the indicator lights still show the jumper pack to be fully charged. I bought the biggest capacity, the GB150. The only complaints I could make are that you have to purchase a case separately, and it doesn't come with a 110v wall charger, but I knew that when I ordered it, so it's not worth knocking a star off for.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is a beautiful product. It has so many uses for you
customer_reviews.text: This is a beautiful product. It has so many uses for you, in addition to the most important one, starting your car. We use this three times in a row to start a Tahoe before we had to recharge. It was only down to half charge when we did that. It has USB ports and cigarette lighter plug ends so you can use many different cables. We got the hard case to protect it. It is a bit pricey, but we don’t think we’ll have to buy another one for years.
customer_reviews.author: holyhill

customer_reviews.title: Compact and Powerful
customer_reviews.text: Perfect Charger - have a 7.1 Diesel engine and starts with one simple key turn. The cables are heavy duty as compared to others AND you do not have to plug them into the charger-they are ready to go. The cables are long enough to comfortably connect to battery...the cheaper/smaller charges barely reach.
customer_reviews.author: noshhtSherlock

customer_reviews.title: Great product worked every time!
customer_reviews.text: Have used 3 times so far. Once on my car and two times on other people’s cars. All three times it started our cars within minutes. I have this in my car at all times. Because you never know when you or someone else will need to use it. I take it out to charge periodically to make sure it is always ready for use especially when traveling long distances. It is also nice because it is smaller than other charges I have seen.
customer_reviews.author: Debra P.

customer_reviews.title: What an amazing device!!
customer_reviews.text: It started up my dead car battery with absolutely no issues, I used the bypass and that got it going. I can't believe how easy it was. This was way better than the other portable jumper I got, it's so strong and actually didn't take too long to charge, especially via cigarette lighter adapter in my other car. I am kinda disappointed of no power adapter (has to be the cigarette lighter or via USB only), but other than that, it's a no-brainer to have this device handy! I love the packaging and the cables and bag it comes with as well. Happy that it is a safe device to use too.
customer_reviews.author: MichaelA

customer_reviews.title: Works better than any other pack I've used
customer_reviews.text: This jump pack is awesome. Works better than any i have used before. Usually at a shop, the ones we get don't last long. This thing starts semis, ag tractors, or small equipment. I was so impressed i had to buy one for myself at home. It's a little more expensive than i wanted but it is worth the cost as it actually works great.
customer_reviews.author: Doriot

customer_reviews.title: Big power on a really small package. Pick up trucks, skid steers, etc.
customer_reviews.text: I work with diesel trucks, excavation equipment, plow trucks, etc on extreme weather in the north east ( down to -10 degrees ) and this thing have not let me down! This thing can start them ALL. I have used it to start Midsize skid steers, 7.3L diesel, 6.2L gas and many more with no problems. Have been able to jump 5 pick up trucks and still have at least 75% charge. If you are looking for a powerfull booster for big engines, you found it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Terrible support.
customer_reviews.text: This is a good booster if it works. Mine would not charge shortly after receiving it and I sent it out For warranty replacement. It’s like pulling teeth to get in contact with Support and even harder to get the replacement sent out. My warranty claim was approved and still nothing. I haven’t had my booster for 8 weeks and my business depends on having a reliable booster pack: The support is awful. Do not buy this product
customer_reviews.author: Alexander V.

customer_reviews.title: Cheap customer service
customer_reviews.text: The first unit arrived not charging. The replacement unit arrived with a bad cord that would not charge the unit and I had to use another cord from another device to see if the unit works. I contacted the manufacturer and their response was to send me a link to Amazon where I can buy a separate charging wire. The have geniuses at work over at Noco. I have not tried the unit to jump anything yet, but right out of the gate (two weeks from the time I ordered this) were not looking favorable.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very impressive looking boost.
customer_reviews.text: Package arrived quickly. I have not used it yet, hope I never need to. The clamps are by far the best looking sturdy ones I've ever seen. I like the ability this has to charge devices with a USB. We travel to the west coast during the winter. Having this gives me piece of mind for my 2018 Silverado diesel and if I need to help a fellow motorist start their vehicle, I don't have to worry about issues with the electronics on my truck.
customer_reviews.author: Bharnz1

customer_reviews.title: Real review after owning for two years. Enjoy it while it lasts. Internal batteries don’t hold up.
customer_reviews.text: Worked good for almost a year. Voltage display quit first and now the batteries won’t take a charge after the second year. Replacement batteries are not available so now it is a paper weight. Good luck if you purchase one.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Worked well but didn't last long
customer_reviews.text: Plenty of power to start my truck with a completely dead battery, but unfortunately it quit working after a year and a half with only a couple uses. When I turn the power on the error light flashes a code for overtemp even though unit is not warm. After troubleshooting, it was determined to be an internal problem. For the price of the unit I expected a better life span.
customer_reviews.author: Sara

customer_reviews.title: Bad product
customer_reviews.text: After 30 days it stopped working and not charging. And ur not accepting returns. Bad experience
customer_reviews.author: mimi

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend this product
customer_reviews.text: This jump starter is very powerful and can start a car or truck many many times before needing a recharge. I've used it to jump cars and trucks upwards of 20 times and haven't had to charge it yet. This thing will start a completely dead battery without even having to wait for it to charge the battery up, and the voltage readout is very handy. Highly recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Wish I would have listened to the reviews
customer_reviews.text: I read the directions and made sure to charge it to 100% as soon as I got it that might need to use it to start a 3l. Diesel engine and couldn’t do it after trying that one time it was completely dead and couldn’t even turn it over again. Very disappointed. Save ur money don’t be cheap and fork out the extra cash for a hi-end name brand one. I’ve used other ones made by tool companies that worked better then they advertised and where half the size. Wish I could say the same about this one.
customer_reviews.author: colton joe medley

customer_reviews.title: Will start anythin!
customer_reviews.text: A friend who worked for a battery supplier said NOCO was the best for portable jump starters and this unit has met all our expectations. Have jump started several car and two diesel pickup trucks. Had another regular jump box that wouldn't budge a larger diesel pickup with a dead battery. Hooked up the NOCO GB150 and the truck started with no hesitation. Would definitely recommend this unit.
customer_reviews.author: Richard C.

customer_reviews.title: Just great.
customer_reviews.text: just great. I work in a dealer as auto technician. I used it very often, even when a vehicle that have a dead battery and a bad alternator I have used it as a power source. Wish mean taking place of alternator while engine is running to move vehicle to working area. It hold at least for 10 minutes. For the size of the battery it is very remarkable.
customer_reviews.author: tony

customer_reviews.title: Impressive/ Reliable
customer_reviews.text: This, most notably, has been used to start a completely dead: Freightliner 6cyl. medium duty aviation refueler, 1996 Dodge Ram 3500 Cummins, 2 Ford Pintos on a trailer(sitting for 20 years). It just works really well, and make sure to order the NOCO case and fast charger. It will do everything you need it to do. If an engine hesitates, just give the charger another 30 seconds to do it's thing. Cables will become a bit warm with enough use, but that's a testament to how much power this unit actually puts out. Not sure what "4000 amps" means, but this is a great product, nonetheless.
customer_reviews.author: Alan W.

customer_reviews.title: Order at your own risk
customer_reviews.text: Had to return it it wpuldnt ecen charge so I never even got to try it Andi tried multiple ways ...I have different gear andam savy but it was just defective...idk if I would spend to much to have an unreliable product I need something I can count on every time for sucha highprice! Sorry I tried but itletme down
customer_reviews.author: 1Doc

customer_reviews.title: Battery swollen after 2.5 yrs
customer_reviews.text: GB70 NOCO stored fine charged to 100% every 6 months in its original box in the garage, until at this past 2.5 year inspection to charge it I saw it was severely swollen. Warranty was only 12 months on this model, so no warranty support unfortunately. Out of warranty repair quote from NOCO was $112 + cost of shipping.
customer_reviews.author: Duck

customer_reviews.title: Small but super powerful!!!
customer_reviews.text: I had no problem starting my eight cylinder diesel with this. Well worth the money. I have had many boosters over the past twenty five years and this is by far the best one I have owned. Would recommend this to anyone looking for a quality booster.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Best jump
customer_reviews.text: A bit pricey! But I actually started my 7.3 diesel truck and 2 gas cars and 1 gas truck same day no recharge! After I started my car car twice in 2 weeks ( completely dead battery) without a recharge!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bottom line - it works!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a beast. With plenty of power to spare and upgraded clamps it is well worth the price of which Amazon was the lowest. I have both the GB70 and the GB150. With either one, attach it to the battery and the car starts, no problem. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: This unit worked fine for a month, now it  won't work at all.
customer_reviews.text: When I first purchased this unit, it would start my car instantly, at most I had to wait 5 minutes. A month goes by and the charging speed decreased dramatically. Now I have to wait no less than 30 minutes to start my car. I always charge this unit prior use just like the instructions direct me to do but the charging speed dropped dramatically as well. I do not recommend this product at all because it will start to malfunction after a short period.
customer_reviews.author: daryt tower

customer_reviews.title: A MUST HAVE!!  Unbelievable power!  This must be what they use in Spacesuits.  Seriously.
customer_reviews.text: ABSOLUTELY something EVERYONE should have!! Will recharge a cell phone like a BILLION times! Bought it a year ago or so, charged it fully once. Since then I've run 12V boat stereo a couple hours off of it, and jumped the car 4 times during a bad battery time. Carried it with me just in case. Had not charged it during this time. Went to finally charge it yesterday after more than a year, and it flashed at 100%. Took just a few minutes to "top off" through the USB connection, which, although the slowest way to recharge, is the easiest. We all have cell phone chargers hanging out all over the place, right?
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Reliable starter.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is incredible. I keep it in my side x side when off roading for long week ends or trips. It starts the motors immediately. I have helped fellow off roaders many times. I have used it on cars, farm equipment etc. Has exceeded expectations. I bought this one for its strength, ease of use and compact size and NOCO has a great reputation. If you are going to get a starter buy this one it's worth the extra money.
customer_reviews.author: Good Guy

customer_reviews.title: Saw this product on Velocity TV and was amazed at how quickly it fired up a the vehicle ...
customer_reviews.text: Saw this product on Velocity TV and was amazed at how quickly it fired up a the vehicle with dead battery. Of course was a bit concerned it might have been edited for TV. Decided to buy anyway from Amazon charged it up and tested it our on one of my vehicles that had been sitting for about 6 weeks. The V-10 engine fired up on the turn of with no problems. I'll be looking for this to be a great boat day saver in the future. Highly recommend for anyone with toys and no time to rotate using them. :)
customer_reviews.author: Will Powers

customer_reviews.title: NOCO BEAST
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this beast of a booster more for peace of mind then anything else.Have a 2109 GMC 3500HD dual batteries. Camping in the boondocks wanted a backup plan in case of emergency. Also plan on using it for a backup power source if no shore power is available for phones or laptops. Feels well made. Came double boxed.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Cooke

product_meta.title: NOCO Boost HD GB150 4000 Amp 12-Volt Ultra Safe Portable Lithium Car Battery Jump Starter Pack For Up To 10-Liter Gasoline And Diesel Engines
product_meta.description: The GB150 is an ultra-portable, lightweight, and compact portable lithium car battery jump starter pack for 12-volt batteries. With it, you can safely jump start a dead battery in seconds - up to 80 times on a single charge. It's a mistake-proof portable car battery jump starter battery booster pack, making it safe for anyone to use and features spark-proof technology, as well as reverse polarity protection. The GB70 portable car battery jump starter integrates with a high-output 500 lumen LED flashlight with 7 light modes. Including low, medium, high, flashing, strobe, and emergency SOS. It can hold its charge for up to one year without being recharged. Its internal battery can be used to recharge any personal mobile devices like smartphones, tablets, or any other USB device, can be recharged by any powered USB port. It's rated at 4000-amps, and suitable for use on gasoline and diesel engines up to 10 Liters, such as a car, boat, truck, and more. Included is the GB150 battery booster jump starter pack, heavy-duty battery clamps, XGC male and female connectors, XGC cable, USB charging cable, microfiber storage bag, a 1-year limited , and lifetime customer support. feature_bullets: Start Dead Batteries - Safely jump start a dead car battery in seconds with this compact, yet powerful, 4000-amp portable lithium car battery jump starter pack - up to 40 jump starts on a single charge - and rated for gasoline and diesel engines up to 10 liters.

UltraSafe - Safe and easy to use car battery jump starter pack without the worry of incorrect connections or sparks. Safely connect to any 12-volt automotive car battery with our mistake-proof design featuring spark-proof technology and reverse polarity protection.

Multi-Function - It's a car jump starter, portable power bank, LED flashlight, and 12-volt portable power. Recharge smartphones, tablets, and other USB devices. It's easily rechargeable from any powered USB port in 6 hours at 2.1-amps. An integrated 500-lumen LED flashlight with seven light modes, including emergency strobe and SOS. Plus, a 12-volt, 15-amp outport port for powering any 12VDC devices, like tire inflators, inverters and more.

Advanced Design - Our most advanced portable car battery jump starter ever. Featuring high-discharge lithium technology for safe operation in any climate. A rugged and water-resistant enclosure rated at IP65. A rubberized over-molded casing to prevent scratching or marring of surfaces. Allows rapid charging in 2-hours via the vehicles auxiliary port. And an ultra-compact and lightweight design weighing just 7.5 pounds.

In The Box - GB150 UltraSafe Portable Lithium Car Battery Jump Starter Pack, Heavy-Duty Battery Clamps, XGC Male and Female Connectors, XGC Cable, Micro USB Charging Cable, Microfiber Storage Bag, User Guide, 1-Year Warranty, and Designed in the USA.
